companyProfile.companyDescription: Infosys Limited is an India-based company, which provides digital services and consulting. The Company enables clients in more than 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation powered by cloud and artificial intelligence (AI). The Company's segments include Financial Services; Retail; Communication; Energy, Utilities, Resources and Services; Manufacturing; Hi-Tech; Life Sciences, and All other segments. The Company's solutions have been primarily classified as digital and core. Its digital solutions include experience, insight, innovate, accelerate, and assure. Its experience solutions include Infosys Aster, Digital Marketing, Digital Commerce and Infosys Metaverse Foundry. Its insight solutions include Infosys Topaz, Infosys Generative AI Labs, Data Analytics, Infosys Sustainability Services and Applied AI. Its core solutions include application management services, proprietary application development services, traditional enterprise application implementation and others.

recentNews.headline: ?Will strive to meet 70-hour-a-week target?: Tejasvi Surya tells Narayana Murthy. Gets THIS reply
recentNews.intro: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya shared insights from a two-hour in-flight conversation with Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy, discussing India's future and joking about a 70-hour work week.
recentNews.imagecaption: BJP MP Surya shares insights from a chat with Infosys co-founder Murthy.

recentNews.headline: Asian Paints, Mazagon Dock, CDSL to BSE: Top stocks that mutual funds bought and sold in June
recentNews.intro: Top largecap stocks that mutual funds bought in June included Asian Paints, Trent, Bajaj Finserv, Infosys, and Bharti Airtel, indicating a tilt towards quality consumption and financial names.
recentNews.imagecaption: Mid-cap stocks that mutual funds bought the most were Dixon Technologies, Biocon, Aditya Birla Capital, Container Corporation, and Star Health Insurance.

recentNews.headline: Shrinking margin leaves HCLTech stock with no room for error
recentNews.intro: Higher sales and marketing investments, lower utilisation, client bankruptcy shrunk the mid cap IT company's Q1 margin, causing the stock to drop 3% on Tuesday.
recentNews.imagecaption: HCL stock has recovered 13% from its 52-week low of Rs�1,302.75 on 7 April. Photo: Reuters

recentNews.headline: Shares to buy in short term: Mehta Equities? Riyank suggests RIL, Tech Mahindra, Infosys stock to buy in near term
recentNews.intro: Indian equity markets opened positively after four days of decline, with Nifty 50 rising 0.14% and BSE Sensex increasing 0.10%. Analysts suggest buying on dips, with key support at 25,000 and resistance at 25,200, while recommending stocks like Reliance, Tech Mahindra, and Infosys.
recentNews.imagecaption: Shares to buy in short term: Mehta Equities? Riyank suggests RIL, Tech Mahindra, Infosys stock to buy in near term

recentNews.headline: As TCS loses shine, investors place hopes on Infosys, HCLTech
recentNews.intro: TCS is losing investor favour as it trails its closest rivals Infosys and HCLTech in revenue growth and mega deals. The TCS stock now trades at a discount, raising questions about the company's ability to retain an edge in a shifting tech landscape.
recentNews.imagecaption: TCS shares have declined by more than 20% this year. (Aniruddha Chowdhury/Mint)

recentNews.headline: To change the world, India Inc must stop hoarding cash and take more risks
recentNews.intro: A bet on smartphones in the 2000s turned Apple into one of the world's most valuable and influential companies, and Google's $1.65-billion buyout of YouTube in 2006 brought in more than $36 billion of revenue in 2024. Why are there are no such stories in India Inc?s history?
recentNews.imagecaption: Steve Jobs unveils the first iPhone in San Francisco on 9 January, 2007. Photo: Reuters

recentNews.headline: Coforge emulates Cognizant, Infosys in on-site consulting push to fuel growth
recentNews.intro: Coforge is adopting strategies similar to Cognizant and Infosys' by placing business consultants at client sites to increase revenue. This approach aims to create tailored solutions by understanding client challenges, and driving proactive deals rather than waiting for request for proposals.
recentNews.imagecaption: The Noida-based company?s decision to place consultants with clients comes at a time non-essential spending is sparse.

recentNews.headline: Will Rishi Sunak work 70 hours a week? Netizens ask as Narayan Murthy's son-in-law joins Goldman Sachs
recentNews.intro: Rishi Sunak is married to Akshata Murty, the daughter of Infosys billionaire Narayana Murthy and his wife Sudha Murty.
recentNews.imagecaption: A handout photograph released by the UK Parliament shows Britain's main opposition Conservative Party's former Prime Minister, Rishi Sunak speaking in the House of Commons in London on June 26, 2025. (Photo by UK PARLIAMENT / AFP)

recentNews.headline: TCS Q1 preview: CEO Krithivasan faces litmus test amid macro uncertainty and slow growth
recentNews.intro: TCS has seen growth decline in the past three years, two of which have been under Krithivasan, and reported the slowest growth amongst India's top three IT firms in FY25. Mint takes a look at five issues analysts and investors will follow closely during its earnings announcement tomorrow.
recentNews.imagecaption: K Krithivasan, chief executive officer of Tata Consultancy Services Ltd. Photo: Indranil Aditya/Bloomberg

recentNews.headline: Bharat Electronics, M&M to Infosys ? These 28 Nifty 50 stocks are trading at rich valuations
recentNews.intro: After months of volatility, the Indian stock market has regained momentum, with major indices increasing 17%. Strong domestic and foreign investment has driven stocks to highs. However, valuation discrepancies persist, particularly in sectors like media and autos, suggesting caution for investors.
recentNews.imagecaption: Bharat Electronics, M&M, Infosys among 28 Nifty 50 stocks trading at rich valuations
